episodes.title: Pt 2: Jesse Samuel Ngoma Street Preaching Chaos by Robin
episodes.description:
Part 2: This week in the UK, notorious street pastor Jesse Samuel Ngoma went viral again for his controversial street preaching videos.

This time, the police were called to the scene in West Croydon for reports that he was causing a public nuisance. He is known to shout into a microphone which is connected to an amplifier. 

He is also known to aggressively insult and provoke people of other faiths and differing sexualities. 
This video and his attitude towards ‘preaching the gospel’ has caught the attention of my dear friend across the pond, Robin! 

Like myself, #Robin was also an assistant of church cult, #UCKG. She has since left and found a biblically sound church that has restored her faith in fellowship after her horrendous experiences in the UCKG.

In this mini serious, Robin breaks down her thoughts on Jesse Samuel Ngoma’s actions and delivery. 

I personally couldn’t agree more with her take on the matter. Not all that glitters is gold, and the Bible is clear on that. 

Robin wanted me to ensure I mention the below verse, as it speaks to the heart of this video:

📖Philippians 3:17📖

What’s your thoughts? Let us know below! 
Watch the full video on my YouTube channel! 
Head over to my bio and don’t forget to subscribe 🔔

#survivinguniversaluk #rachaelreign #christiantalk #streetpreacher #streetpastor #JesseSamuelNgoma
subjects: Universal Church Of The Kingdom Of God

episodes.title: Part 2: I Spent My Teens in a Church Cult (UCKG) in South London
episodes.description:
Most people don’t believe a dangerous cult could exist right here in South London. But it did — and I was in it.
This mini-series is my unfiltered truth.
How they found me.
How they broke me.
And how I fought my way out.

#CULTTALK | A survivor’s story by Rachael Reign

This is part 2, where I speak about how I was isolated, groomed and made to become a UCKG assistant. 

If you’ve ever questioned a so-called “church” that felt more like a trap…
If you’ve been told obedience is love…
If you’ve ever been shamed, silenced, or spiritually abused —
This is for you.

You are not alone. You are not crazy. And you deserve to be free.

✨ NEED SUPPORT OR WANT TO KNOW MORE?
See our site survivinguniversaluk/linktree
Insta: @survivinguniversaluk 
@msrachaelreign 
Surviving Universal UK is the UK’s leading survivor-led movement tackling spiritual abuse, cultic coercion, and church-based harm. We see you. We believe you. And we’ve got your back.
Email: info@survivinguniversaluk.org

episodes.title: Cult Talk: Do You Worship God, Or Church?
episodes.description:
When Church Becomes a Cult: Are You Worshipping God or Just Your Church?
I used to think loyalty to my church meant loyalty to God… until I realised I was losing myself in blind obedience.

This video is about the uncomfortable truth many won’t say out loud: some churches aren’t pointing you to God—they’re pointing you to themselves.
Let’s talk about:
⚠️ Blind loyalty vs genuine faith
⚠️ How control and conformity show up
⚠️ When your identity becomes church-branded, not God-rooted
⚠️ Why it’s time to stop making your church the main character

If you’ve ever felt confused, silenced, or guilted into loyalty—this one’s for you.
👇🏾 Let me know in the comments: have you ever had to unlearn church culture to find God?

🔔 Don’t forget to subscribe for more truth, healing, and hard conversations.
✊🏾 We’re not anti-God. We’re anti-control disguised as faith.  #ChurchTrauma #SpiritualAbuse #DeconstructingFaith #CultRecovery #ChurchHurt #ToxicChurchCulture #BlindLoyalty #FaithNotFear #GodOverChurch #ChristianTikTok #ChurchVsGod #LeavingACult #HighControlGroups #ReligiousTrauma #Exvangelical #FaithOverFear #HealingFromChurch #ChristianCults #IdentityInChristNotChurch #rachaelreign #survivinguniversaluk #suuk  #AccountabilityIsNotPersecution
subjects: Universal Church Of The Kingdom Of God

episodes.title: Talking To My Son About Why Some Churches Are Not Good
episodes.description:
Talking to My Son About My Experience in a Church Cult
In this video, I have an honest conversation with my son about some of the painful experiences I had growing up in a high-control church — often referred to as a cult. We talk about what makes a church healthy or harmful, and how to spot the difference between faith that uplifts and control that breaks you down.

As a survivor, I believe these conversations matter — not just for healing, but for protecting the next generation. If you’ve ever struggled with spiritual abuse, church trauma, or questioning your faith upbringing, this video is for you. 🧡

✨ Let me know in the comments: What would you want your children to understand about your story?
And if you’ve had to unlearn toxic teachings to find peace — you’re not alone.

Subscribe for more real talk on healing, faith, and freedom.
